questions.text: According to Indian Penal Code, McNaughton’s rule is adopted under which section?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

IPC 84

Highyeild:

Section 84 in the Indian Penal Code Act of a person of unsound mind Nothing is an offense which is done by a person who, at the time of doing it, by reason of unsoundness of mind, is incapable of knowing the nature of the act, or that he is doing what is either wrong or contrary to law. Section 83 in the Indian Penal Code Act of a child above seven and under twelve of immature understanding nothing is an offense which is done by a child above seven years of age and under twelve, who has not attained sufficient maturity of understanding to judge the nature and consequences of his conduct on that occasion.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.CrPC 84- deals with property claim. Option C.CrPC 48-A police officer may, for the purpose of arresting without warrant any person whom he is authorized to arrest, pursue such person into any place in Option D.IPC 48- The word vessel denotes anything made for the conveyance by water of human beings or of property.

Table:

#MANTRA I.P.C. Section associated with consent S. 87 Person>18 yr of age can give consent for any surgery or procedure. S. 88 Nothing is an offence , done in good faith for the benefit of the patient with consent from the patient, even if complications happen. S. 89 Child<12 yr/ insane person, consent of a parent is a must. S. 90 Consent given by a child<12 yr,insane person or given under fear or fraud is invalid. S. 92 In an emergency, if it is impossible to obtain consent from a patient or relative of a patient, a surgery/procedure can be performed without consent. S. 53 Crpc 53(1).An arrested patient or accused can be examined by the doctor without consent of the person upon a written regulation by a police officer not below the ranking of a sub-inspector. 53(2). If this arrested person is a female, then the examination will be done by a lady RMP. 53(A). Procedure of a examination of accused of rape.

questions.text: Basisphenoid fuses with basioccipital at what age?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

18—25 years The basilar part of the occipital bone (also basioccipital) extends forward and upward from the foramen magnum , and presents in front an area more or less quadrilateral in outline. In the young skull this area is rough and uneven, and is joined to the body of the sphenoid by a plate of cartilage . By the twenty-fifth year this cartilaginous plate is ossified , and the occipital and sphenoid form a continuous bone.

Highyeild:

Age from skull sutures–closure can be estimated as: Metopic suture: 3 years/may remain unfused 20 years : Basi occiput fuses and basisphenoid 30 to 40 years : Sagittal suture–post one-third 40 to 50 years : Anterior one-third of sagittal suture + lower half of coronal suture 50 to 60 years : Middle sagittal + upper coronal suture Lambdoid suture : Starts closing near lambda and completed around 45 years Most reliable : Sagittal > Lambdoid > Coronal

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A, B and D are incorrect.

Table:

#MANTRA All the ossification centers around the elbow joint will fuse with their respective shafts by 16 – 17 years ,hence the best X-ray to determine the age of 16 – 17 years is elbow joint. As head of femur, lesser trochanter and greater trochanter fuse by 17 -18 years ,the best X-ray to determine the age of 17 -18 years is the hip joint. Lower end of femur, upper end of tibia and upper end of fibula fuses by 18 – 19 years .Best X-ray for 18 – 19 years is Knee joint. Upper end of femur, because iliac crest & ischial tuberosity fuses by 20 – 21 years .Best X-ray for 20 – 21 years is Hip joint.

questions.correct_answer: A. Child born after father death
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Child born after father death Posthumous child –born after the death of his father -mother being conceived by said father.

Highyeild:

Superfecundation (1 cycle, 2 oocytes): occurs when two different ova are fertilized by two different sperm in more than one act of coitus during the same cycle. They are of the same gestational age. Superfetation (2 cycles, 2 oocytes) :occurs when a second fertilized ovum implants in a uterus already containing a pregnancy of at least 1 month. Superfetation has been suggested in some cases in which the twins are markedly discordant for birth weight, supposedly due to different gestational ages. Suppositious child : is a spurious child produced for inheritance claims or other malicious reasons . Posthumous child : is a child born after the death of the father . To be legitimate the child should be born within 280 days of the death of the father. Pseudocyesis/ spurious pregnancy/ Phantom pregnancy/False pregnancy :Intense desire for pregnancy by a married person → starts experiencing symptoms suggestive of pregnancy (Amenorrhoea, Bloating of abdomen , quickening movements).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B.Child born after mother death- is called a coffin birth. Option C.Child born before father death - is a legitimate child. Option D.Child born out of marriage - is an illegitimate child

Extraedge:

Legitimacy: Section 112 IEA A child is presumed to be legitimate if born during: Continuance of a valid marriage Within 280 days after its dissolution–mother remained unmarried.

questions.text: Which is the first organ to putrefy?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Brain Among the given options , Brain is the first organ to putrefy.

Highyeild:

Decomposition/Putrefaction - Putrefaction is the process of decay or rotting in a body or other organic matter Main cause: Clostridium welchii producing Stages: Color change: Earliest external sign: greenish discoloration of Right iliac fossa. Earliest internal sign: Green/Reddish/ Brown discoloration of vessel wall/Aorta. Marbling of veins: Irregular discolouration of network of veins Forensic importance: Marbling is suggestive of Time since death (TSD) of 36-48 hr Formation of gasses- Blisters all over the body. PM purge_-Blood stained froth from mouth and nostrils Organs show putrefactive changes in the following order: Larynx and trachea Stomach and intestines Spleen Liver: Honeycomb appearance (‘foamy liver’) Brain (brains of infants putrefies early) Heart and lungs Kidneys and bladder Blood vessels Uterus—last organ to putrefy in females . A gravid uterus decomposes earlier than a non-gravid uterus Prostate–last to decompose in males Followed by skin, muscle and tendon Skin, hair, nails, teeth slippage in 2,3,4,5 days respectively. Liquefaction of tissue By 5-10 days Tissues: greasy,black substance Casper dictum: Rate of decomposition in Air: Water: Earth =1:2:8 Last to decompose: Males-Prostate < bone (last) Females-Virgin uterus< bone(last)

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Sequence of organ decomposition is: Option A.Brain→ Option C.Heart→Option B. Kidney→ Option D.Prostate

Solution:

Odorless Mummified bodies are odorless.

Highyeild:

Mummification Hot and dry climate favors it sandy, shallow graves Mechanism Drying and shrinkage of cadaver due to evaporation of water Features of the body are preserved A mummified body is odorless Time taken: 3 months – 1 year Arsenic and antimony, poisoning favors it. Medicolegal importance of adipocere and mummification Face can be identified The cause of death can be determined because injuries are recognize. The time since death can be estimated.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option B, C and D. are incorrect as Mummified bodies are odorless.

questions.text: Blue colored gastric mucosa on autopsy is due to poisoning by:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Copper Blue discoloration of gastric mucosa is commonly seen with poisonings with copper sulfate, copper succinate , dyes such as methylene blue, toluidine blue and food coloring agents.

Highyeild:

Copper: Common toxic compounds are— Cu sulfate (blue vitriol) - emetic PM findings are: Greenish-blue–froth at mouth/nostril Gastric mucosa and content– greenish/bluish Chronic Cu poisoning: Wilson’s disease –associated with copper toxicity Vineyard sprayer’s lung –chronic inhalation of copper sulphate spray Green or purple line on the gums -Burtonian line (as in chronic lead poisoning) Hair, skin and perspiration may become green (golden hair).

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Arsenic - show red velvety stomach. Option B. Mercury -stomach color is grayish Option C. Sodium amytal -shows congestion of abdominal viscera.

Extraedge:

Poison Stomach finding Sulphuric acid Black,perforation common Nitric acid yellow Phenol Leather bottle appearance Arsenic Red velvety Copper sulphate Bluish green Phosphorous Garlicky Iodine Mucous membrane brown, content Blue Organophosphorus smell of kerosene Oxalic acid Calcium oxalate deposit

Table:

#MANTRA ODOUR OF POISONS Acrid -pear like chloral hydrate >paraldehyde Acetone -apple like Chloroform, ethanol Bitter almond Cyanide Burnt rope Marijuana(cannabis) Carrots hemlock(cicutoxin) Garlicky Arsenic, OPC, Phosphorus, Alphos Glue Toluene Kerosene OPC Rotten fish Alphos, zinc phosphide Rotten egg H2S SHOE-POLISH Nitrobenzene Vinegar Acetic acid

questions.text: Muscle pain, nephropathy caused by which metal poisoning:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Mercury can cause muscle pain and nephrotoxicity.

Highyeild:

Mercury poisoning- Is a nephrotoxic poison. The initial stage has glossitis and ulcerative gingivitis which appear in 24 to 36 hours followed by loosening of teeth and necrosis of jaw. Renal tubular necrosis and gangrenous colitis may appear. Chronic Hg poisoning–Hydrargyrum Hatter’s shake or Glass blower’s shakes: First involves hands then lips and tongue finally involves arms and legs. Coarse with jerky movement . Other features are: In addition to the classical muscle symptoms, there is a spectrum of autonomic and central nervous system symptoms, including paresthesia, pain, excessive sweating, tachycardia insomnia, personality and mood changes, anxiety, and depression. Mercurial erethism: Excitability, memory loss, insomnia, timidity, sudden attacks of anger and later delusions and hallucinations– mad as a hatter. Mercurial lentis: Deposition of mercury on the anterior lens capsule , bilateral and has no effect on visual acuity. Acrodynia: Pink disease or Swift’s disease. Minamata Bay epidemic: Due to chronic organic Hg poisoning (1955). T reatment: N-acetyl D-penicillamine/BAL.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option A.Arsenic- causes cholera like features,upper GI pain. Option B.Cadmium causes nephrotoxicity and ouch disease (ita-ita). Signs and symptoms include golden yellow staining of teeth, bone pains, osteomalacia and waddling gait. Option D. Lead is the most common chronic heavy metal poisoning. Signs and symptoms include Burtonian lines along gums, nocturnal spasmodic abdominal pain, wrist drop and foot drop, irreversible brain damage in children and lead osteopathy - radiopaque bands along metaphysis.

Extraedge:

Poison causing nephrotoxicity- Carbolic acid Oxalic acid Methanol Heavy metals

questions.explanation:

Theory of exchange Locard is famous for theory of exchange.

Locard exchange principle- ‘Whenever 2 objects come in contact with each other, there is a mutual transfer of material from one object to the other’. Basis of all crime detection .

questions.text: In Maastricht classification of donation after cardiac death which category is stage 3?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Awaiting cardiac arrest In Maastricht, the classification of organ donation after cardiac death of a patient awaiting cardiac arrest is category III. Category III donors are patients on intensive care units with non-survivable injuries who have treatment withdrawn; where such patients wished in life to be organ donors , the transplant team can attend at the time of treatment withdrawal and retrieve organs after cardiac arrest has occurred.

Highyeild:

Maastricht classification: Non-heart beating donors are grouped by the Maastricht classification. I Brought in dead II Unsuccessful resuscitation III Awaiting cardiac arrest IV Cardiac arrest after brainstem death V Cardiac arrest in a hospital inpatient

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options:- Option Brought in dead- is category I. Option Unsuccessful resuscitation- is category II. Option Cardiac arrest after brainstem death- is category IV.
